WRITING.TITLE: What's the most horrible / scariest death you've ever heard of?

WRITING.TEXT: Mines the Nutty Putty cave incident. Where John Jones went caving with his family and got stuck upside down in a VERY small hole and died there 28 hours later, rescue attempts failed... nightmares!
Holy shit.

WRITING.TITLE: Easy trick for wood gathering!
WRITING.TEXT: I always forget which trees I already chopped wood from. So I have a handy tip for you guys! I first chop all the wood from every tree without picking it up. Then when every tree has wood next to it you can pick it up! That way you can be sure you've hit every tree! Hope this helps some of you! #9825;

I showed him some of the replies of you guys and he said that people on reddit are a certain type of people (especially on this forum) and that if he would ask 'normal people' the same (like his coworkers for example) that they would side with him. I just can't fight him on this because I think he thinks he is always right.

Thank you. He told me that the reason he thinks its okay to do is because he thinks its not that big of a deal and not dangerous. I told him that rapists also think this way eventhough the two arent nearly comparable.
Thats what I thought everyone thinks! But he tells me everyone would say its not a big deal. Thats why i posted this, because he makes it seem like that boundary isnt valid at all! But thanks so much
What youre saying is making a lot of sense. I love him a lot though, when we arent fighting he is very sweet I just really wish he could respect me some more. Thank you so much
Thank you. Yeah its because he thinks its funny no other reason, and youre right he doesnt gain anything from it by doing it. Couldn't even begin explaining that tho.
Well, lately i have been kinda depressed and totally not in the mood. He gets a little upset about that but its understandable because the past few months i really didnt want to do anything.
I honestly dont know he disrespects me sooo often. He makes me think i am the bad guy and im scared of him finding someone 'better' for some reason. Im just really scared of leaving, really scared.
Thank you i appreciate your reply!
So he just told me he does in fact not respect me because i am always a bitch and always have something to be upset about. Thats why he doesnt respect me and does those things.

Thats a really good point. I honestly dont know why he does it. I mean its okay if he teases me with stuff thats part of a relationship but i was clearly upset and scared and got really angry. I think thats why he did it again as well because i got really angry the first time
Almosy 2 years. We also live together.

I really appreciate that. Ill try to explain; i honestly dont respect myself enough to leave. I am EXTREMELY insecure. The thought of him being with someone else really scares me eventhough he treats me bad sometimes. Im also not saying im doing everything right! Because of my depression i have been distant and angry a lot. I just dont know what to do. I really love him when hes nice

Well he did get realllly upset when i got angry the first time. Shouldnt that be enough for him to not do it again? Also; he told me he did it again after that because then id get used to it?? That confused me
How do i leave? Im really scared of leaving and him finding someone better
Thank you so much
Yes that happens a lot!
I do realise how it looks to all of you and should look to me. But i just dont see him as an abuser at all. I guess love makes you blind right
Thank you so much!!
I really wish i knew!

I dont know what to do. How did you get out of that relationship? My mental health is horrible and i feel like i couldnt handle a breakup where he makes me feel like the one at fault! What did you do?

How did you leave him? I really dont think i could handle a breakup where i would feel like the bad guy in the end because of him. My mental health is already extremely bad right now. Any tips are very welcome!
Thank you so much i appreciate this a lot!! Everything you said makes so much sense and makes me feel less alone in this, thank you so much again.
Thank you so much and im so sorry you had to go through that! I hope youre doing a lot better now and wish you all the happiness in the world!

WRITING.TITLE: Made my own cute Switch stand! #128155; #128149;

WRITING.TEXT: I kinda knew how to make it beforehand and while making it i just added some stuff here and there:)

WRITING.TITLE: Massive OCD / restart problem, need help!:(
WRITING.TEXT: Hey guys! So I have had a massive issue ever since I discovered New Leaf. Whenever I start a game I have to do EVERYTHING ABSOLUTELY PERFECT! If I, for example, walk into a tree or don't position myself just right in front of a mailbox or item to interact with it I get a horrible feeling and if other things go 'wrong' after that I have to restart. The worst is when I walk into a villager and 'push' them on accident. If I make a mistake the whole 'save data' is ruined and the only way to keep playing is to clean my switch, delete my save and all the pictures I took and restart. I have played New Leaf thousands of times but didn't manage to keep a town for longer than 2 weeks at most. I'm a huge AC fan and got NH when it came out and have restarted 300 times at least. Im suffering extremely bad because of this. I don't have OCD in my normal day to day life but once I start a game of any kind I face this problem. I just don't know what to do, I just want to enjoy a town for more than a few hours/days.. I really hope some of you have any tips or maybe know why this happens to me. Please don't tell me to just enjoy it and don't worry about it, I know, I've tried. If i try to ignore the 'mistake' it gets worse in my head and eventually I have to restart because all the joy of playing vanishes. This really affects my mental health as well. If I manage to keep a town for 2 or 3 days Im ecstatic and can play for hours at a time, then when the inevitable happens I'm heartbroken.. Any tips are more than welcome !!! lt;3

Yes I've thought about this as well. I have pretty bad mental issues outside of games. I talked to someone about this a long while back and they said it's possible I lack a sense of 'control' in life and therefore want to do everything 'perfect' in games because I CAN control that part. Idk though thanks for replying, what you said made a lot of sense!
Thank you I appreciate this a lot. lt;3

I did this in New Leaf. If I did something wrong I simply quit without saving and tried again. This only worked a few times though. In NH you have the autosave so that would be difficult. However I'm gonna try the day back and then forward for sure, thanks so much.

WRITING.TITLE: Massive Animal Crossing OCD problem.
WRITING.TEXT: Hey guys! So I have had a massive issue ever since I discovered Animal Crossing New Leaf. Whenever I start a game I have to do EVERYTHING ABSOLUTELY PERFECT! If I, for example, walk into a tree or don't position myself just right in front of a mailbox or item to interact with it I get a horrible feeling and if other things go 'wrong' after that I have to restart my entire game. The worst is when I walk into a villager and 'push' them on accident. If I make a mistake the whole 'save data' is ruined and the only way to keep playing is to clean my switch, delete my save and all the pictures I took and restart. I have played New Leaf thousands of times but didn't manage to keep a town for longer than 2 weeks at most. I'm a huge AC fan and got New Horizons when it came out and have restarted 300 times at least. Im suffering extremely bad because of this. I don't have OCD in my normal day to day life but once I start a game of any kind I face this problem. I just don't know what to do, I just want to enjoy a town for more than a few hours/days.. I really hope some of you have any tips or maybe know why this happens to me. Please don't tell me to just enjoy it and don't worry about it, I know, I've tried. If I try to ignore the 'mistake' it gets worse in my head and eventually I have to restart because all the joy of playing vanishes. This really affects my mental health as well. If I manage to keep a town for 2 or 3 days Im ecstatic and can play for hours at a time, then when the inevitable happens I'm heartbroken.. Any tips are more than welcome !!! lt;3

Thank you so much, "trying to design your island with lots of space - wide paths and lots of space around items you interact with to minimize the possibility of bumping into villagers or misaligning yourself" this is an amazing idea! I restart the most on my first trip to a mystery island, because everything is so close together and you're just bound to bump into something. I don't think there's a solution to that tho. Thanks so much!!! lt;3
Unfortunately you can only have 1 island per switch:( Yeah I do try to make small mistakes on purpose to kinda show myself its not that bad but that has often led to a restart
